com.robopupu.api.feature

Interface FeatureTransitionManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FeatureContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FeatureContainerAdapter, FeatureTransitionManagerAdapter, PluginActivity

    public interface FeatureTransitionManager
    FeatureTransitionManager defines an interface for objects that can be used to show FeatureFragments and FeatureDialogFragments. Typically a such object is an Activity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canShowView(View view)
      Tests if the given View can be shown by this FeatureTransitionManager.
      void showDialogFragment(FeatureDialogFragment dialogFragment, boolean addToBackStack, java.lang.String fragmentTag)
      Shows the given FeatureDialogFragment.
      void showFragment(FeatureFragment fragment, boolean addToBackStack, java.lang.String fragmentTag)
      Shows the given FeatureFragment.

    • Method Detail

      • canShowView

        boolean canShowView(View view)
        Tests if the given View can be shown by this FeatureTransitionManager.
        Parameters:
        view - A View.
        Returns:
        A boolean.

      • showFragment

        void showFragment(FeatureFragment fragment,
                  boolean addToBackStack,
                  java.lang.String fragmentTag)
        Shows the given FeatureFragment. Each shown FeatureFragment instance has to be supplied with a tag that can be used to retrieve the instance later on. If parameter fragmentTag is given null value, the tag is set to be the class name of the FeatureFragment.
        Parameters:
        fragment - A FeatureFragment. May not be null.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the View is added to back stack.
        fragmentTag - If the FeatureFragment is to be added to back stack then a String used as a tag to identify the FeatureFragment has to be given. In most cases tag can be simply the class name of the FeatureFragment. If null then the FeatureFragment is not added to back stack

      • showDialogFragment

        void showDialogFragment(FeatureDialogFragment dialogFragment,
                        boolean addToBackStack,
                        java.lang.String fragmentTag)
        Shows the given FeatureDialogFragment. Each shown FeatureDialogFragment instance has to be supplied with a tag that can be used to retrieve the instance later on. If parameter fragmentTag is given null value, the tag is set to be the class name of the FeatureFragment.
        Parameters:
        dialogFragment - A FeatureDialogFragment. May not be null.
        addToBackStack - A boolean value specifying if the View is added to back stack.
        fragmentTag - If the FeatureDialogFragment is to be added to back stack then a String used as a tag to identify the FeatureDialogFragment has to be given. In most cases tag can be simply the class name of the FeatureDialogFragment. If null then the FeatureDialogFragment is not added to back stack
